alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued September 11 at 8:17PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE ... This Hydrologic Outlook is for Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan in the Mariana Islands. A tropical circulation continues to slowly develop northwest of the CNMI. This system is forecast to gradually strengthen as it continues to move away from the region. As it does so, the latest model forecasts continue to show another weak circulation developing very near the CNMI and move slowly to the west. This in turn allows a monsoon flow to develop over the CNMI, and the Marianas. Todays models remain at odds with regard to how gets how much rainfall, and when is the best potential for heavy rainfall to occur. Timing: Wednesday through Friday Locations: The Mariana Islands Amounts: Northern CNMI - 4 to 7 inches Tinian and Saipan - 3 to 5 inches Guam and Rota - 2 to 4 inches Note: All locations may see locally higher rainfall totals Should this occur as forecast, urban and small stream flooding would be a possibility. Closely monitor this developing situation in the event watches, advisories, or warnings are needed. Forecasts will likely change in the next few days. Make sure nearby storm drains are not clogged, especially for low-lying or flood-prone areas.
